intro: Bolboschoenus desoulavii, commonly known as the Madagascar sedge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Bolboschoenus desoulavii plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
